Content: affix added to nouns forming words which refer to a specific one of several:
That fish there, not that one further over.
added to possessive pronouns: the particular one that belongs to [so-and-so].
Dakù ang amúang balay, gamay tung iláha,
Our house is large, and theirs is small.
affix added to adjectives to form exclamation.
I’ll kill you, you dog you!
particle used as a pause word before starting to speak.
Um, are you going to come here tomorrow?
deprecating or showing unimportance of what just preceded.
Oh, it’s all the same to me.
Oh, yes. There were two of them, weren’t there.
Oh, so your name is Lito.
particle preceding or following a sentence with an adjective predicate.
dismissing s.t. as impractical, too easy, impossible, etc.
à, mu ra diay nà? Kasayun à!
Oh, is that all there is to it? How easy it is!
à, ása man ku mutúu nímu,
Hm, you think I could believe you?
How come you have such a beautiful dress on!
ábà tuy, maáyu ka lang sa tayáda, wà kay tadtad,
Shut up! You’re great at talking, but let’s see you do s.t.
act, treat like, consider a hillbilly.
You just think I’m a hillbilly. Don’t try to fool me.
be the boss and not henpecked.
Ab-ábun sa irù ang íyang hikut,
The dog will chew up his rope.
Ang pagluib ni Maríya nag-ab-ab sa íyang balatían,
Maria’s infidelity ate away at his insides.
Giab-ab ang íyang pinútì sa tayà,
His sword was eaten away by rust.
give material help, help do work.
Kinsa may mag-ábag nímu sa ímung pag-iskuyla?
Who will help pay for your schooling?
sweet potatoes growing from the outer vines and not from the main root.
Abagáhun (pangabagáhun, pangabagáhan) ni Mánuy níya ang galastúhan sa pag-iskuyla,
His brother will shoulder his school expenses.
We must undertake to carry out this program.
bound by s.o.’s will. <i lang="ceb">Abáhu (báhu) kunsidirasiyun
Ug ikaw muabalu sa ákung yútà, ayawg dak-a,
If you assess my land, don’t set it too high.
Ang yútà miabalu (giabalu, giabaluhan) ug singkwinta mil,
The land was assessed at fifty thousand pesos.
Purus dagkug abalwasiyun ang mga yútà dinhi sa syudad,
The lots in the city all have high assessments.
Nag-abandunar na lang siya sa íyang kaugalíngun sukad mamatay ang íyang asáwa,
He neglected himself entirely after his wife died.
Ang usa ka kwartu giabángan sa tigúlang,
The old man rents one of the rooms.
make an offering to a supernatural being for the use of land which is thought to be in his possession.
Iábang ni nákung baktína álang sa uma,
I will sacrifice this pig as rental for the land.
How much rent did you pay for the book?
Kadtung nalumus dinhi ábang kunu tu sa ingkantu,
The man who drowned here is said to have been the rent collected by the supernatural spirit.
do s.t. step by step, and in sequence.
Iabánid (abaníra) kini pagpintal arun dílì magkampat,
Paint it one square at a time so it will come out even.
Abánid ang íyang pagsukut sa mga istudyanti,
He asked the students one after another in turn.
fan of any sort for fanning oneself.
blackberry lily, k.o. bulbous ornamental: Balamcanda chinensis. It is so called because the leaves are arranged like an opened fan.
s.t. made in such a way that it can be folded for storage, e.g., a folding chair, jackknife.
for s.t. to be directly open to the wind.
Naabansáda sa hángin ang ákung bukubuku, maung gisip-un ku,
My back was directly exposed to the wind. That’s why I caught cold.
Ayaw abansadáha (iabansáda) sa hángin ang inyung bintánà,
Don’t put a window right where it catches the full breeze.
grand rally immediately prior to an election.
advance, for a body of people to move forward.
Ang mga Hapúnis miabansin sa pátag sa Lusun,
The Japanese advanced over the plains of Luzon.
You took a seat too far to the front.
Muabanti kag diyútay, matambug ka sa bangag,
If you move forward any more, you will fall into the hole.
Move your car forward a bit.
be ahead, have more points in a game.
We were ten points ahead of you.
Dì ku makaabanti sa galastúhan sa iskuylahan,
I cannot keep up with the school payments.
Dì ku makaabanti sa pagdáru kay dautun ku,
I can’t keep up with the plowing because I’m sickly.
ask part payment in advance, especially in salary.
give s.o. a cash advance on his salary or other payment.
The front tire of the motorcycle is flat.
any supernatural being or human with supernatural powers which shows itself in an unexpected and startling way.
Maapsan pa nímu siya ug ímung abatun sa iskína,
You can still catch up with him if you head him off at the corner.
frighten s.o. by appearing suddenly or otherwise startling him.
When he comes by, give him a scare.
haunted, place where things appear suddenly.
s.o. to whom spirits tend to show themselves.
Wà giyud mi magkítà, nag-abat-ábat lang,
We just kept missing each other.
hold on to s.t. fixed to support oneself.
Ang tigúwang miábat sa pasamánu paingun sa táas,
The old man held on to the bannister while going upstairs.
a railing in shape of a ladder for baby to cling to when he starts to walk.
feel with the hands, esp. to find s.t. out.
Nag-ábat siya sa yáwi sa íyang bulsa kung wà ba hibyai,
He felt for the key in his pocket to see if he hadn’t left it behind.
Abátun ku ang íyang agtang ug hilanatun ba,
I’ll touch her forehead to see if she is feverish.
feel s.t. with the sense of touch.
Nakaabat ku sa kabugnaw sa sinihan,
I felt the coolness of the movie house.
Abátun gánì nímu ang kasakit, musamut giyud,
If you think about the pain, it will get worse.
Nakaabat kung mu rag may misaka sa ámung báy,
I sensed that s.o. had entered our house.
move along together with s.t. moving.
Lagmit hiligsan ang bátà kay nag-abay sa tartanilya,
The child is likely to be run over because he is running alongside of the rig.
The two swam side by side.
have a snake born at the same time one is born. The snake is called one’s twin (
) and is supposed to bring him and his family luck.
Pagkatáwu sa ákung iyaan, giabayan (giabyan) ug sawa. Mau nang nadátù ang íyang inahan,
When my aunt was born, a twin snake was born with her, and so her mother became rich.
go in with s.o. who buys or invests in s.t.
Ug mupalit kag usa ka sákung humay muabay kug lima ka gantang,
If you buy a sack of rice, I will go in with you for five ganta’s worth.
Giabyan níyag singku písus ang ákung pusta,
He went in for five pesos on my bet.
go in together in a fishing operation which requires several hands.
money paid as a share in a purchase or investment.
Ang ákung abay bálig dus písus ra,
My share is two pesos’ worth.
title used by males of the same age to each other.
Where is this jeep headed for, driver?
manner of tying a gaff to a cock level with and parallel to the spur to offset any advantage it may have over its opponent.
persons who go in together in a fishing operation.
Alang kaníya walà siyay láing abyan kun dílì álak,
He has no other friend except liquor.
supernatural being that provides a shaman or sorcerer with his power.
He did not indulge in roaming about.
k.o. snapper with a yellow streak along the body: Lutianus sp.
diminish s.t. by taking away or destroying part of it.
Naabhak (naabhákan) ang íyang abága sa bála,
The bullet tore a huge piece out of his shoulder.
hole left when s.t. is chopped off, out.
Dakù kaáyu ang abhak sa káhuy,
There’s a big cut in the tree.
done in such a way that s.t. is chopped off.
Abhak nga pagkabuldúsir ang inyung nataran,
musty and flat in smell: damp clothing, rice, sweet potatoes, salted fish, et al.
ábi nímu? Nakit-an ku siya nga láig kúyug,
You know what? I saw him going out with s.o. else.
ábi kay nakadaug sa byúti kuntis midakù na ang úlu,
Just because she won the beauty contest she thinks she is s.t.
Fight back. They might think you give up.
Mu giyud ning táwung iládu, abiabíhun giyud sa mga tagilungsud,
The townspeople show hospitality to any famous visitor.
cheer one on, encourage to do.
Egging the children on in their naughtiness.
ability, capacity or skill to accomplish s.t.
Abilidaran nà si Tunyu. Bansayng mutínis,
Tony has talent. He plays tennis well.
polish shoes with a light tan polish, color them tan.
Dye these shoes of mine tan.
Wà kuy bitung itum. Abilyanáhi lang,
I don’t have any black polish. Just put tan polish on them.
engage in an enterprise or game together.
Let’s become partners in selling food.
Mga hakug sa gahum ang miábin kaníya,
People who were greedy for power allied themselves with him.
Nakig-ábin aku kaníya sa íyang mga panglantaw sa unáhan,
I share his views of the future.
Ug siyay ákung ábin sa bíku kanúnay ming mudaug,
When she is my partner in hopscotch, we always win.
Makítà siya sa mga lílas abintúra,
try going s.w. for the adventure of it.
We went on an expedition to Mt. Manunggal.
Miabinturar (nangabinturar) lang siyag aplay básig madáwat,
He tried his luck in applying in hopes he might be accepted.
Try your luck with Maria and ask her.
adventurous, tending to try things out without knowing the outcome.
Dì ku mugugul ug kwarta niánà kay dì ku abinturista. Básig dì musalir,
I won’t invest my money on that because I’m not daring. It might just fail.
particle used in calling attention to a point in contention.
Ang diyus makagagáhum. Abir, unsáun man nímu pagpangutána diin siya manukad,
God is almighty. All right then, how can you ask where He comes from?
particle used in inciting a person to do s.t.
Abir, sulayi ug musalir ba nang paagíha,
O.K. Just see if that procedure works out.
Abir, sumbága kunu ku kay isumbung tikaw ni Pápa,
All right, just try hitting me, and I’ll tell Daddy on you.
pause word expressing hesitation when one doesn’t know how to do s.t.
Abir, lisúa nag hínay dúngan sa pagtulbuk ári,
Let’s see now, turn that slowly and press this at the same time.
try one’s luck, take a stab at.
Nangabir (miabir) lang siyag panlútù. Dì hinúun siya kamau,
He just took a try at cooking. He doesn’t really know how.
Abirun unyà nákug hangyù si Maríya,
I’ll just take a stab at asking Maria.
Iabir kunu ni sa ahinsiya ug dawátun ba,
Try taking this to the pawnshop and see if they will accept it.
average, the usual size or quantity.
Pasar ku kay utsinta ákung abirids,
I passed because my average was eighty.
We can sell on the average five every day.
for an engine to break down.
Kining trak dílì magámit. Nag-abiríya man,
This truck cannot be used. It is broken.
Naabiríya aku kay nagkalíbang aku gahápun,
I’m not feeling well because I had diarrhea yesterday.
slice with a curved blade, cut a small or thin part from a bigger piece.
Slice a piece off of it.
slice the terminal portion of a coconut bud to induce sap flow.
They make an incision in the bud twice a day.
Nag-abísu ang radyu nga adúnay bagyung umaábut,
The radio announced that there is a typhoon coming.
We received the announcement that there would be no water tomorrow.
habit, a distinctive apparel worn by devotees, priests, monks, and the like.
food, provisions, money, supplies for daily consumption.
Báhin sa mga kinahanglanun matag adlaw akuy muabíyu,
As far as your daily needs go, I will provide.
Abyúhan ta lang mug usa ka sákung humay matag búlan,
We’ll supply you with one sack of rice a month.
Abkáyun ku ang kwarta nga ákung gilubung dinhi,
I will dig up the money that I buried here.
speak to s.o. with some purpose in mind.
Abláhi kunu si Máma, básin pag musugut,
Try to talk mother into it. She might let us.
Dílì ka sugtun niánang bayhána kun walà kay abla,
That woman will not accept you if you don’t sweet-talk her.
It was all just big talk. No action.
art or technique of expressing one’s viewpoint.
Malampúsun siyang abugádu kay maáyu siya sa pangabla,
He is a successful lawyer because he has a good technique in talking.
The chorus is spoken, not sung.
Were you the one who opened the door?
Sulud lang kay nag-abli ang pultahan,
Just come right in. The door is open.
begin, start a class, business, etc.
Ablíhag (ablíhug) sayu ang klási sunud túig,
Classes will open early next year.
Anus-a man ablíhi (ablíha) ang inyung iskuylahan sa panahì?
When will you open your sewing school?
That can has a big opening.
Abli ang bintánà. Sirhi ra gud,
The window is open. Please close it.
Abli na ang tindáhan. Palit ngadtug kapi,
The store is open now. Go buy some coffee.
Abrap ra kaáyu nang ímung pag-anhi,
be sudden, do s.t. by plunging right into it.
You answered in a brusque way.
Hulat kay muabrása kug lakaw ninyu,
Wait for me. I’m going to walk next to you.
Dílì ta mag-abrásag lakaw sa karsádang hagip-ut,
We shouldn’t walk side by side on a narrow street.
promenade arm in arm or side by side.
Nakit-an kung ímung bánang may giabrasíting (giabrasitíhang) babáyi,
I saw your husband walking arm in arm with a woman (with a woman holding on to his arms).
Beer is good to stimulate the appetite.
one who works on a boat for his passage.
be an apprentice, apprentice s.o. to.
work in lieu of paying passage.
Magbakasyun mu sa Hunyu? Ah, Abrila lang,
Will you take your vacation in June? Oh, just make it in April.
write down April in a document.
Máyu ímung nabutang? Abrila lang hinúun,
Did you write May? It should be April.
absent, fail to attend work or class.
Just miss your class this one time.
Daghag absin nímu Dyú, lagmit ka mahagbung,
How many absences you have, Joe! You’re likely to flunk.
Anus-a gud nà siya makapasar nga absinus man nà sa klási,
How can he pass if he always misses classes?
Gilubung siya nga walà gánì kaabsulusyuni,
He was buried without having received absolution.
Ang musáyaw sa tinikling kinahanglang abtik ug tiil,
Mahuman ni dáyug abtik lang mutrabáhu,
It will get done right away if you work rapidly.
Abtik giyud siya kay midáwat imbis mubáyad,
He sure is sharp. Instead of paying as he should have, he got paid.
get to be fast in action.
Muabtik (maabtik) lagi ang íyang panglíhuk basta pakit-ug sápì,
He’ll get moving fast as long as you show him money.
The child put one over on me.
Ayaw kug pangabtíki kay suhítu ku,
Don’t try to put a fast one over on me, because I know my way around.
rope used for tying the plow to the crosstree.
Abuha nang mga palwa ug gam-ang sabun,
Make the palm stems into ashes to make soap out of.
be razed or burned to the ground.
Pag-abut nákù naabu na ang balay,
When I arrived, the house was already burned to the ground.
Nagkaábu ku kay misum-uk ku sa nasunúgan,
I got ashes all over me because I went into the burned-out area.
stove or any place a fire for cooking is built.
be jealous of a loved one.
Ang bukbukung mais mauy iábud sa manuk,
Throw the beetle-infested corn to the chickens.
drop grains into a hole in planting.
Keep feeding grains into the mill.
supply a factory with raw materials.
Kanang kumpaniyáha mauy tig-abud sa mga papil sa imprinta,
That company supplies paper to the printing press.
Ikaw diay nag-abud sa mga nutisya,
So you were the one who spread the news!
It’s my turn to feed (the chickens).
ornamental bulbous plant: Eurycles amboinensis. The leaves are applied over the bladder to facilitate urination.
k.o. head louse lighter in color and with a longer and more slender body than the ordinary head louse (
Muabug ang karsáda ug dúgayng uwanun,
The road gets dusty if the rains come late.
Giabug ang ámung balay kay dúgay na nga wà puy-i,
Our house became all dusty because it hadn’t been lived in for a long time.
Tabúni ang libru arun dílì maabugan,
Cover the books so they won’t get dusty.
In the end we will all turn to dust.
Nagkaábug ang ákung buhuk tungud sa byáhi,
My hair is all covered with dust because I’ve just gotten off the bus.
Kining kwartúha alabúgan. Duul man gud sa karsáda,
This room is exposed to dust. It’s close to the street.
Abúga ang bábuy ngadtu sa tangkal,
Drive the pig into the pen.
Drive the flies away from the table.
Ang kaúlaw mauy nag-ábug kanákù pagpaháwà sa ámung lungsud,
Shame drove me to move out of town.
stick with strips of paper, plastic, etc., attached on one end, used to chase flies away.
an enclosure of the fish corral into which the fish are driven before being caught.
Abugadúhan ta lang ka kay wà kay pangabla,
I’ll speak for you because you don’t have the knack of saying what you want.
